intro: Tovomita laurina, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of white, waxy flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and is often grown as an ornamental due to its striking appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Tovomita laurina is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
